com.gemalto.idp.mobile.fasttrack.protector

Interface TokenDevice

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    CapTokenDevice, OathTokenDevice

    public interface TokenDevice
    The interface TokenDevice. TokenDevice is used to compute OTP.
    Since:
    5.3.0

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void activateBioFingerprintMode(java.lang.String pin)
      Activate BioFingerprint mode.
      void authenticateWithBioFingerprint(android.os.CancellationSignal signal, BioFingerprintAuthenticationCallbacks callbacks)
      Authenticate with bio fingerprint and this is an asynchronous call.
      void changePin(java.lang.String oldPin, java.lang.String newPin)
      Change pin using the following rules: A PIN rule that prevents using identical PINs. A PIN rule that prevents a PIN from being uniform, ex: 11111. A PIN rule that prevents a PIN from being a palindrome, ex: 12321. A PIN rule that prevents a PIN from being a series, ex: 1234, 4321. A PIN rule that specifies minimum length of 4 and maximum length of 8
      void deActivateBioFingerprintMode()
      Deactivate BioFingerprint mode.
      MobileProtector.OtpType getType()
      Get tokenDevice type

    • Method Detail

      • changePin

        void changePin(@NonNull
               java.lang.String oldPin,
               @NonNull
               java.lang.String newPin)
        throws FastTrackException
        Change pin using the following rules:
        • A PIN rule that prevents using identical PINs.
        • A PIN rule that prevents a PIN from being uniform, ex: 11111.
        • A PIN rule that prevents a PIN from being a palindrome, ex: 12321.
        • A PIN rule that prevents a PIN from being a series, ex: 1234, 4321.
        • A PIN rule that specifies minimum length of 4 and maximum length of 8
        Parameters:
        oldPin - The old pin
        newPin - The new pin
        Throws:
        FastTrackException - The exception (if any)

      • isBioFingerprintModeActivated

        boolean isBioFingerprintModeActivated()
        Is BioFingerprint mode activated boolean.
        Returns:
        The boolean

      • activateBioFingerprintMode

        void activateBioFingerprintMode(@NonNull
                                java.lang.String pin)
                         throws FastTrackException
        Activate BioFingerprint mode.

        Warning: The SDK will not be able to detect if PIN value is correct or not. Giving invalid PIN causes the tokenDevice to end up in a unrecoverable state. Integrator may need to validate the PIN value through OTP verification on the server before performing this operation.

        Parameters:
        pin - The pin text
        Throws:
        FastTrackException - The exception. Check for FastTrackException constant error codes for more information. Possible error codes are:
        • FastTrackException.BIO_FINGERPRINT_NOT_SUPPORTED
        • FastTrackException.BIO_FINGERPRINT_NOT_CONFIGURED
        • FastTrackException.INTERNAL_ERROR

      • deActivateBioFingerprintMode

        void deActivateBioFingerprintMode()
                           throws FastTrackException
        Deactivate BioFingerprint mode.
        Throws:
        FastTrackException - The exception. Check for FastTrackException constant error codes for more information. Possible error codes are:
        • FastTrackException.INTERNAL_ERROR

      • authenticateWithBioFingerprint

        void authenticateWithBioFingerprint(@NonNull
                                    android.os.CancellationSignal signal,
                                    @NonNull
                                    BioFingerprintAuthenticationCallbacks callbacks)
        Authenticate with bio fingerprint and this is an asynchronous call. Update is provided on the callbacks.
        Parameters:
        signal - The signal is used for cancel the authentication process. Please manage the object carefully as the same object passed in this call are required to fire the cancellation call.
        callbacks - The callbacks which updates application integrator on the authentication progress. Callbacks are fired on the Main thread.

      • getType

        MobileProtector.OtpType getType()
        Get tokenDevice type
        Returns:
        tokenDevice type
